dmca.title: RE: Copyright Claim
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: Anthony Thomas [mailto:athomas@eyecandymodeling.net] 
Sent: Friday, June 01, 2007 12:28 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: Copyright Claim

Andrea Z. Almedia (Designated Agent) or To whom it may concern,


You have a customer who has a website called http://www.bikinibikini.com
and
they have a message board where their members constantly posts
copyrighted
images that we own that they hacked from our websites which are:

http://www.eyecandymodeling.com
http://www.eyecandyxtreme.com
http://www.eyecandyxotic.com
http://www.londoncharles.com
http://www.naughtyneshelle.com
http://www.absolutelyamber.com
http://www.annahourglass.com
http://www.ataunleashed.com

One thread in particular blatantly brags about hacking our sites and
even has
it on its title "EYECANDYMODELING THREAD (updated often)"
http://www.bikinibikini.com/forum/thread140538.html

I've contacted these people several times and they NEVER responded to
any of
my request to remove these posts. You can easily identify our images by
our
logo "ECM" or the actual website url on the picture.  By ignoring our
request
to remove these threads on this message bored has cost us alot of
potential
money because their board members have in their mind to not sign up for
our
website when they can just see all the pictures on this message board
for
free. This particular thread was created on 02-28-2007, 12:25 AM and its
now
June 1, 2007.  So its obvious nobody from www.bikinibikini.com cares
about our
request and chose to keep ignoring us.  

This is my last attempt to resolve this before I seek legal action.

Thank you!


--
Anthony Thomas
Phenomenon Productions
Eye Candy The Magazine
http://www.eyecandymodeling.com
http://www.anthonythomasphotography.com
dmca.principal_name: Phenomenon Productions (for Eye Candy The Magazine)
